snippet: In one of the largest mass military defections since the Syrian conflict began 16 months ago, the soldiers entered the town of Reyhanli with a group of refugees, Turkish news agencies reported.
abstract: Turkish news agency reports that 85 Syrian soldiers, including one general and at least 14 lower-ranking officers, fled into southern Turkey’s Hatay Province; it is one of the largest mass military defections since the Syrian conflict began 16 months ago.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Istanbul, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: In one of the largest mass military defections since the Syrian conflict began 16 months ago, the soldiers entered the town of Reyhanli with a group of refugees, Turkish news agencies reported.

headline.seo: Dozens of Syrian Soldiers Defect En Masse to Turkey
headline.main: Eighty-Five Syrian Soldiers, Including a General, Defect en Masse to Turkey
headline.print_headline: 85 Syrian Soldiers, Including a General, Flee to Turkey

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
